description: From Latin conspicuus (“visible, striking”), from cōnspicere (“to notice”), from con- (“with, together”) + specere (“to look at”).

adjectives.description: conspicuous (comparative more conspicuous, superlative most conspicuous)

examples: He was conspicuous by his absence.

entries.meaning: Noticeable or attracting attention, especially if unattractive.
examples: He had a conspicuous lump on his forehead.
